title: Accessibility problems
description: When I launch the Help view, I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas (e.g. the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame) before it starts working. Otherwise, the tab key does not actually do anything. This issue occurs on Win2K with the date 20020326.
OB: When I launch the Help view, the tab key does not work unless I click on one of the 'live' areas.
EB: When I launch the Help view, the tab key should work without needing to click on any 'live' areas.
SR:
1. Launch the Help view.
2. Press the tab key and observe that it does not do anything.
3. Click on one of the 'live' areas (e.g. the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame).
4. Press the tab key again and observe that it now works as expected.
